      • transitions

        public java.util.List<burlap.mdp.singleagent.model.TransitionProb> transitions​(burlap.mdp.core.state.State state,
                                                                               burlap.mdp.core.action.Action action)
        Possible transitions from the current state How it works: Broadly the idea is to create a base state, with what's guaranteed to change from an action being taken already incorporated. Then that base state is turned into a TransitionProb with an assumed 100% chance of happening. After that the TransitionProb is put in a list and sent through a bunch of functions that enumerate normal possible occurrences during game play splitting each entry in the list into multiple with the same total probability. At the end of the function there should be a list with every reasonable permutation of what could happen in the game, and with an approximate probability assigned.
        Specified by:
        transitions in interface burlap.mdp.singleagent.model.FullModel
        Parameters:
        state - current state
        action - action being considered
        Returns:
        a list of most possible states that could be transitioned to.
